CatDescriptText: Mr. Henry Alston, clerk, 1117 N. Franklin Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 3, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Who do you think is responsible for the failure to pass effective civil rights legislation in Congress?"  Answer reads: "The conservative Republicans of the North and the Southern reactionaries who join and form coalitions of Dixicrats [sic] to help each other defeat or secure the laws they want."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Henry Alston wearing gabardine pants, moustache, pencil held behind ear, and straw hat with wide striped band, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Thrift Drugs store in background, Downtown
